properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow for the Alaska Highway tonight. An arctic front advancing from the north will usher in a return to winter driving conditions along the Alaska Highway (Highway 97) tonight mainly through the Steamboat Mountain to Summit Lake corridor. A total of 10-15 cm of snow can be expected as the front passes through the area with lesser amounts away from this corridor. Showers will turn to flurries late this afternoon before heavier snow will begin late this evening. Snow will taper off Thursday morning however a few flurries are likely to remain. Higher elevations and exposed areas could also experience gusty winds overnight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-14T05:00:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-13T13:01:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3197621628.2020
Area: Muncho Lake Park - Stone Mountain Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures will drop to minus 4 to minus 6 Celsius early this morning resulting in frost and freeze conditions. These conditions may damage or destroy tender fruit crops and other frost sensitive plants. Outdoor plumbing and irrigation systems could also be damaged. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-13T20:24:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-13T08:31:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4272426118.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Locations: the Eagle River portion of the Trans Labrador Highway, the Upper Lake Melville area, and Rigolet. Time span: continuing into this afternoon. Remark: A mixture of rain and wet snow will continue tonight and Thursday. Accumulations are not expected to be significant. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-14T05:30:31-00:00

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will once again drop near or slightly below the freezing mark overnight tonight. Temperatures will reach the seasonal values Thursday afternoon. This will mark the end of the unseasonably cold temperatures that have been in place for several days. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-14T06:52:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-13T14:53:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0428800477.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected in the Natuashish area. Total snowfall: 15 to 30 cm. Time span: today and tonight, diminishing in intensity Thursday morning. Snow may continue into Friday, but accumulations will not be as significant. Remarks: The Nain area will receive 5 to 10 cm of snow before conditions improve Thursday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-14T05:29:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-13T13:30:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4079644621.2020
Area: Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Locations: inland areas from Lodge Bay to Cartwright, including the Eagle River portion of the Trans Labrador Highway, the Upper Lake Melville area, and Rigolet. Time span: until this morning for Norman Bay to Lodge Bay. Continuing into this afternoon elsewhere. Remark: A mixture of rain and wet snow will continue tonight and Thursday in the Upper Lake Melville and Rigolet areas. Accumulations are not expected to be significant. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-14T00:18:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-13T08:19:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2993891050.2020
Area: Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity, Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of snowfall is expected, especially over higher terrain. Location: west coast of Newfoundland. Time span: tonight until Thursday evening. Total snowfall: from 5 to 10 cm along the coast to near 20 cm inland and over higher terrain. Remarks: A mix of flurries and rain showers will change to flurries tonight and persist until Thursday evening. The snow is expected to be wet and heavy along the coast, with the highest accumulations occurring tonight as temperatures cool to freezing. It is advised to reduce travel over higher terrain during this event as the potential for total snowfall amounts higher than 20 cm exists. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-14T10:20:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-13T18:21:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3866850279.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A significant prolonged snow event is expected. Total snowfall: 35 to 60 cm. Locations: Hopedale to Makkovik. Time span: Snow will gradually ease in intensity on Thursday; however, snow and slight accumulations may continue into Friday or Saturday. Remarks: Greatest snowfall accumulations are expected inland and over higher terrain and could locally exceed the amounts mentioned above. Areas along the coast may experience some periods of rain or wet snow, which would drastically reduce snowfall accumulation. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-14T10:43:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-13T18:44:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0725623643.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
